result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica Claire Mahlum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erica Claire Mahlum is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erica Claire Mahlum was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3.5 Year total; 18 Months Initial Confinement; 2 Years Extended Supervision 
- Defendant must serve minimum 18 Months prior to release.
- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Chippewa County Case 20CF146

superMiscConds.notes:
- $268.00 Court Costs, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CF296 Count 2. 
- $250.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CF296 Count 2.

- DNA Sample 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested 
- Absolute Sobriety
- Apply for Eau Claire County Drug Court Treatment Program
- Eau Claire County Drug Court Treatment Program to be considered as ATR

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:58 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Fox,  Defendant Erica Claire Mahlum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared by video for Erica Claire Mahlum.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing re: jail credit. Attorney's have an agreement regarding credit. Court orders JOC to be amended to reflect 122 days credit. Adjourned at 3:04 pm.

11:16 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Erica Claire Mahlum. Defendant Erica Claire Mahlum in court, in custody. Court reviews case. DA Anderson recites resolution. WOPH: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. PLEAS: Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Amended complaint to be filed. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 2: Possession of Narcotic Drugs- 961.41(3g)(am). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Counts 1, 3, and 4 in case 22CF296. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

 Count 2: 3.5 Years Total; 1.5 Years Initial Confinement; 2 Years Extended Supervision; Concurrent to Chippewa County Case 20CF146. Defendant must serve minimum 18 months prior to release.

- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Apply for Eau Claire County Drug Court Treatment Program
- Eau Claire Claire County Drug Court Treatment Program to be considered in the event of Revocation.


Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

Adjourned at : 11:48 AM
